name: Sacrifice
desc: Sacrifices a friendly creep and converts its current hit points into mana for Lich.

name: Drunken Haze
desc: Drenches a target in alcohol, causing their movement speed to be reduced, and causing their attacks to have a chance to miss.

name: Caustic Finale
desc: Sand King's attacks inject a venom that causes enemy units to violently explode when its timer expires, or when the unit dies, damaging and slowing nearby enemies. Deals less damage if its timer expires.

name: Bash of the Deep
desc: Grants a chance that an attack will do bonus damage and stun an enemy.  The duration is doubled against creeps.

name: Flak Cannon
desc: Gyrocopter's attacks hit all enemy units in an area around it for a limited number of attacks.  Only the main target of attacks will receive attack bonuses such as Critical Strike.  Lasts 15 seconds or until the attacks are used.

name: Call Down
desc: Call down an aerial missile strike on enemy units in a target area.  Two missiles arrive in succession, the first dealing major damage and minor slow for 2 seconds; the second dealing minor damage and major slow for 4 seconds.\n\nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.

name: Rolling Thunder
desc:
Pangolier curls into a magic-immune ball and rolls out. When rolling, he moves at an increased speed and can move through trees, but has a decreased ability to turn. Striking enemies knocks them back, inflicting damage and stunning them when they land. 

Colliding with walls or cliffs will cause a temporary pause while Pangolier reverses in direction.

DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel

name: Heat-Seeking Missile
desc: Launches a pair of rockets at the nearest visible enemy heroes within 2500 range. \n\nUpgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.

name: Chemical Rage
desc: Alchemist causes his Ogre to enter a chemically induced rage, reducing base attack cooldown and increasing movement speed and regeneration.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel

name: Liquid Fire
desc: Jakiro burns his enemies in an area of effect with fire added to his attack, while slowing their attacks.
